ratings.comment: Extremely passionate and knowledgeable about the subject and very friendly during office hours. Provides a great overview of the entire continent from many different perspectives in only a semester. Many interesting guest lectures. Heavy reading load, but exams and 5 page paper are manageable if you do the work.
Has a passion for Africa and sticks to the lecture outlines site well. You can't really complain about the midterm and final because he gives you the questions ahead of time.

Professor Delehanty is the professor you want. He's really smart, totally unbiased, passionate, extremely helpful, very nice, clear about what he is teaching and what he wants, and actually has interesting lectures. For example, he had Koo Nimo in class for a live performance and Q & A, how awesome is that? I had him for honors and have enjoyed it.

Lecture was usually interesting, essay midterm and exams that you get before hand to prepare. Only homework is a five page paper that is extremely easy. I highly recommend Jim, he's a very interesting guy. Stop in for office hours, he'll talk about anything!  He tried to convince me NOT to go to Africa!

Lectures are long, but easy to understand. He has you read lots of books but they are interesting. The class topics are really interesting! I recommend the class, it's cross listed with just about every topic so it's a great class to fill in the holes in credits. Exams are essay exams, but he gives you the questions in advance.
Somewhat interesting. Don't need to attend lecture, just go to section and do the readings.

Great speaker, covers a lot of interesting topics. His lectures can feel long and drawn out at times but that can happen with any power lecture. His exams can be lengthy, but he gives you the exam questions in advance. Good class if you need the humanities credits.

If you are even remotely interested about learning about Africa, take this class. Delehanty is an outstanding professor and a great lecturer. You will truly get a lot out of this course if you attend the lectures. Exams are a little difficult but he gives you essay questions ahead of time.

I expected too much.  Class was kinda boring and very hard to get an A.  I had a great TA which made things a little easier..  Don't take for an easy/fun class, it's a lot of work.  25 % paper was VERYYYY easy.
Pretty good.

He is the MAN!! Tests are LONG and ESSAY BASED!!! He gives you the 8 out of 4 questions for both midterm and final....one paper outside of class...a LOT of reading and you need to do it ALL....he gives away alot of themes and answers in lecture....GO TO LECTURE! YOU WILL FALL BEHIND IF YOU DONT!!! BEST TEACHER AND MOST INTERESTING at MADISON! TAKE

A little bit wordy at times... it took me a little while to get used to his lecture style. Really awesome and interesting guy, though, and he definitely wants students to succeed (if they do their work). Essay questions are given to you beforehand, which is nice, except you have to prepare them.
Very engaging and intelligent lecturer, really enjoyed his style of teaching and the class as a whole. He was very approachable and friendly! I would definitely recommend him!

Professor Delehanty's lectures were great. I highly recommend this class to anybody looking for social science credit- a great introduction to learning about African cultures. Delehanty is extremely helpful and his lectures are easy to follow.

Great teacher--clear, knowledgeable, and very approachable. Class brings in guest lecturers from lots of disciplines, and most are quite interesting. Workload is reasonable--a moderate amount of reading, midterm and a final, and an easy paper. If you need honors social sci credit, take his section--it's engaging w/out requiring much extra work.

Gives essay questions before the tests, so if you take the time to prepare, you'll be fine. WONDERFUL lecturer. The class is very interesting overall because of all the guest lecturers he brings in. I would definetly take this class again.
Exceedingly good teacher, lectures are informative, has a lot of guest lecturers that are not that helpful
He is dynamic and presents information in an incredible comprehensive manner.

By far one of the best professors I've ever had.  Prior to this class I wasn't much interested in Africa at all and now I want to study abroad there!  He's very passionate about his subject, cares about his students and lectures very clearly.  Amazing class!
meh. this class was OK.  could have been better but fairly easy class.

I loved this class. He actually does give you the essay questions ahead of time, but he won't necessarily use all of them. By far one of the best and most interesting classes and professors I have had here. Go to class and do the readings, and you'll be fine. It's an eye opener.
He is a great lecturer. However, his curve is not a motivating factor. Essay exams and does not give you the questions ahead of time. Cares about what you can "throw-up" not concepts.
One of the best professors I've had.  Very organized and knowledgeable on the topic.  Amazing class, definitely take if he is teaching!

Prof. Delehanty is approachable, amiable, and just plain awesome; clear lecturer, always willing to answer questions, constantly available and helpful outside of class. My TA wasn't that helpful, but do the readings and you'll be fine. I think this class has been the most informative and broadening of all the classes I have taken here.

His lectures were very organized with outlines.  The guest lectures were hit or miss, esp miss towards the end of the semester.  Discussions werent very effective for me but overall the class was good.  One midterm, one final and one easy article analysis paper.  One issue is it is a bell curved graded class, i got an A but it took work

Great Prof. and excellent lectures.  Brings in experts from all over campus to talk about a wide variety of topics.  Really gets you thinking about the material, African society and your own pre/misconceptions. One midterm, final, and paper (6-8 page).  I highly suggest this course to anyone. Caution-taking this course may steer you into the major!
No Comments
I really learned a lot from the class and he made it interesting and fun.  He gave very organized lectures.
